sn45.4:1.2: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn45.4:1.3: He saw the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi driving out of Sāvatthī in a splendid all-white chariot drawn by mares.
sn45.4:1.4: The yoked horses were pure white, as were the ornaments, chariot, upholstery, reins, goad, and canopy. And his turban, robes, sandals were white, as was the chowry fanning him.
sn45.4:1.5: When people saw it they exclaimed,
sn45.4:1.7: It’s a vehicle fit for Brahmā!”
sn45.4:2.1: Then Ānanda wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened, adding,
sn45.4:3.7: “Sir, can you point out a Brahmā vehicle in this teaching and training?”
sn45.4:4.2: “These are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
sn45.4:4.3: ‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.
sn45.4:5.1: When right view is developed and cultivated it culminates with the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.4:5.8: right immersion is developed and cultivated it culminates with the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.4:6.1: This is a way to understand how these are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
sn45.4:6.2: ‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.”
sn45.4:6.3: That is what the Buddha said.
sn45.4:7.1: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn45.4:8.2: are always yoked to the shaft.
sn45.4:8.3: Conscience is its pole, mind its strap,
sn45.4:9.2: its axle is absorption, and energy its wheel.
sn45.4:9.3: Equanimity and immersion are the carriage-shaft,
sn45.4:10.4: as it rolls on to sanctuary.
sn45.4:11.3: The wise leave the world in it,
